hanzi-su-wiki:
獣

Значения

Животное, зверь

Мнемоника

По теории пяти строк собака 犬 (съедобна) и бык входят в пять разновидностей домашних животных. Точки вверху — остатки от ртов (на поле кричат), ниже — поле 田, хомут и рот 口 быка.

Варианты

獸, 兽
purpleculture_pinyin:
shòu
Japanese variant of 兽
Японский вариант зверя
rtega_mnemonic:
獸獸RS
兽兽		獣beast, animal, bestial
  • RS. an animal 嘼 such as a dog 犬
heisig_constituent: animal, owl, rice field, brains, one, mouth, chihuahua, dog, large, drop
heisig_story: Owl . . . rice field . . . one . . . mouth . . . chihuahua.
koohiiStory1: The owl looks for its prey in the rice field. It sees so many potential animals to eat but since it only has one mouth, it decides that the tasty looking chihuahua will be its meal for tonight. (adapted from Copycatken,1-9-2006).
koohiiStory2: I have a strange story for this one but it works. I imagine a owl getting into a rice field which serves as a boxing ring. His opponent is a little chihuahua. The fight starts, the owl takes one punch to the mouth and is out cold. In the chihuahua´s corner is that coach from Rocky saying "Your an ANIMAL!!". A vivid image of this story works pretty well for me.
jp_example_words:
怪獣(かいじゅう): monster
獣(けだもの): beast, brute
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: On the grass near a rice paddy sits a creeper that is some sort of a dog beast, a vicious animal. This creeper isn’t just a normal dog, it is more beast-like, more like a feral animal than domesticated pet.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this beast creeping, low to the ground, in the grass around the rice paddy. It's got its eyes on you. Uh oh.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The beast is guarding its precious jewels (じゅう), which it buried in the grass or the rice paddy somewhere. If you don't want the beast to think you're coming to steal those jewels, you better keep your distance.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: All beasts have something they're trying to protect. In this case, it's some beastly jewels.
Ru_Radicals: 口 (рот), 尚 (ещё), 犬 (собака), 田 (рисовое поле)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the dog (犬) with one (一) mouth (口) in the small (⺍) rice field (田) is a beast

Name meaning

shòu
яп. вм. 兽
Radicals: 田, 犬  (rice-paddy, dog, grass, creeper)
Meaning Mnemonic
On the grass near a rice paddy sits a creeper that is some sort of a dog beast, a vicious animal. This creeper isn’t just a normal dog, it is more beast-like, more like a feral animal than domesticated pet.
Picture this beast creeping, low to the ground, in the grass around the rice paddy. It's got its eyes on you. Uh oh.
Reading Mnemonic
The beast is guarding its precious jewels (じゅう), which it buried in the grass or the rice paddy somewhere. If you don't want the beast to think you're coming to steal those jewels, you better keep your distance.
All beasts have something they're trying to protect. In this case, it's some beastly jewels.
